During  the experiment of purposely interrupting or re-routing Neon currents, I got the idea I could build more complex controlsystems with that.
For the time being, deliberately contaminated silicon wafers happen to be the the ideal base material. Out of these I could develop an universal base component, which I call a transistor.

They operate fairly easily, there's an input and an output, which are usually separated. Though if I use a current to create a forcefield at a control-input, the material changes so that in- and output get connected.
With enough of these parts could presumably realize every form of logic and controls. First I have to develop a suitable crafting station.
